.. _`Troubleshooting`:

Troubleshooting
===============
This section describes some common issues that can arise and possible solutions.

Issue #1
--------
Problem: Difficulty in setting up the Python virtual environment.
Solution: Ensure that Python and pip are installed correctly. Veryify you are using the correct pyhton statements for your OS. Use `python -m venv env` to create a virtual environment and activate it using `source env/bin/activate` on Unix or `.\env\Scripts\activate` on Windows.

Issue #2
--------
Problem: Tests failing due to missing dependencies.
Solution: Double-check the `requirements.txt` file contains all required packages and ensure all dependencies are installed to your venv not your local machiene.

Issue #3
--------
Problem: Documentation not building correctly.
Solution: Verify that all `.rst` files are correctly formatted and that the `make` command is executed in the `docs` directory. Also ensure that Sphinx is installed locally and configured as needed.
